Chicago.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":23.51,"start":20.634}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Of course, the shot starts at the lake.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":26.51,"start":23.51}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Camera pans over the water, and the magnificent buildings rise from the shoreline, twinkling in the dawn light.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":33.8,"start":26.51}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We continue across the city, still bird's eye view, over the grid, over the elevated tracks and wide highways, coming to rest in a Western suburb.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":43.67,"start":33.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Drop down to a brick bungalow where, inside, a woman, late 30s, moves softly past the bedrooms where her children sleep and steps out the front door to meet the morning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":54.38,"start":43.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Wind chill of 20 below.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":57.59,"start":54.38}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She hurries to a minivan.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":59.49,"start":57.6}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And as she pulls away from the curb, we see the streets frosted with salt, the moon shining high and hard.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":65.43,"start":59.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And we see her work ID, where she keeps it on the center console, the words \"board-certified RN\" and her name in all caps.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":74.06,"start":65.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This is Mindy Figueroa.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":76.37,"start":74.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy says she was made to be a nurse.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":79.37,"start":76.37}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I think I was just born to be in health care.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":82.33,"start":79.38}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"As a kid, my sister would find all the dolls and the ballet slippers at the Dollar Tree section.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":90.15,"start":82.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"But I always got the doctor kit --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":93.12,"start":90.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"the stethoscope, the little syringe.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":95.88,"start":93.12}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Always, always, always.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":97.64,"start":95.88}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So it was just always a thing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":100.43,"start":97.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy was the first one in her family to go to college.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":103.59,"start":100.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Her parents came to this country undocumented from Mexico, worked factory jobs, earned citizenship.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":109.67,"start":103.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy paid her way through school, got her degree, started out at a small hospital, and after a few years, transferred up to a big one, UI Health at the University of Illinois at Chicago.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":122.92,"start":109.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She works on the labor and delivery floor with patients about to have babies.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":127.57,"start":122.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I've been told many, many times that as soon as I walk in the room, they know I like my job.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":133.18,"start":127.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I love coming to work.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":136.64,"start":133.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I feel like they feel that.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":138.23,"start":136.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I walk in a room, and good morning, my name is Mindy.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":141.35,"start":138.23}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I will be here until 7:00 PM.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":144.37,"start":141.35}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We watch this happen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":146.12,"start":144.38}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy stepping cheerfully into a labor room, her face framed by two neat braids.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":151.61,"start":146.12}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And then we carousel through shots of Mindy at work --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":154.63,"start":151.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy strapping a fetal monitor to a patient's belly; Mindy at the nursing station, holding a plastic pillow up like show-and-tell, her colleagues doubled over in laughter; Mindy, her face grave, bursting through the door of the OR.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":171.07,"start":154.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy loves the intimacy of labor and delivery and that adrenaline, that switch from it's calm to, now, it's time to run.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":179.03,"start":171.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And also, I mean, I just like blood in general.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":181.88,"start":179.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I like --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":182.72,"start":181.88}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"You do?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":183.023,"start":182.73}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Yes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":183.94,"start":183.033}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Like, you mean like, literally, you like blood?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":186.74,"start":183.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Yes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":187.573,"start":186.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And everyone on the unit knows it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":189.59,"start":187.573}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"If there is a hemorrhage, if there is heavy bleeding, they know I am the person.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":195.2,"start":189.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I like to weigh it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":196.52,"start":195.2}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I like to quantify the blood.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":198.82,"start":196.52}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I like to clean it up.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":201.31,"start":198.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Blood clots coming out of a --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":203.53,"start":201.31}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"after delivery, and we're pushing on their belly.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":206.11,"start":203.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And it's almost like popping a pimple.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":209.14,"start":206.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Like, OK, let's get it out of there to prevent more bleeding.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":212.71,"start":209.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I feel like I'm really good at recognizing when we're trending towards too much blood because I am actually watching.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":222.2,"start":212.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I watch every birth.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":223.49,"start":222.2}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I watch every C-section.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":225.16,"start":223.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I don't sit and chart.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":226.64,"start":225.16}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"As soon as the incision starts, I watch it because it's just intriguing to me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":232.25,"start":226.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I've been doing this for 14 years, and it still amazes me that there's an incision on an abdomen, but there's a baby there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":243.44,"start":232.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I watch every delivery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":245.27,"start":243.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":247,"start":245.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This story is going to be about one of those deliveries that Mindy watched, one that changed things for her and for her hospital.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":254.22,"start":247.01}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There are more than 2,000 deliveries a year at UIC.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":259.87,"start":256.839}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's a public hospital, not a fancy one.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":262.55,"start":259.87}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And it's located right in the middle of the city, in the medical district.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":267.31,"start":262.55}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Establishing shot of the hulking building, dawn breaking open, the sky above.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":274.09,"start":267.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A humble hospital in Chicago, a hard-working nurse, a delivery with stakes --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":279.68,"start":274.09}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"how could we not tell this like a medical drama?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":283.57,"start":279.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A medical drama --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":285.19,"start":283.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"its emphasis is on the world inside the hospital, on the heart and the heroism of the people who work there, and their relationships with one another, and how their interactions with patients are shaped by their own stories.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":298.6,"start":285.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But what happens in a hospital also reverberates outside.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":302.47,"start":298.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And on this show, we're going to see that, too, because this delivery that Mindy watches, it doesn't just change things at UIC.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":310.63,"start":302.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It could change things for the entire country.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":312.84,"start":310.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And now let's pull back, get the whole hospital in the frame, and end the opening credit sequence with this image, this boxy building on a subzero morning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":325.93,"start":315.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But we know that behind that imposing facade, it's warm.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":329.47,"start":325.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We're already invested in the human drama inside.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":334.24,"start":329.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Black screen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":334.965,"start":334.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"[MONITOR BEEPING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":337.308,"start":334.975}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The action of the episode begins with Mindy in a nearly empty elevator.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":349.54,"start":345.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Closer to 7:00 AM, change of shift, you can barely fit.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":352.84,"start":349.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's sardines.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":354.39,"start":352.84}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But Mindy's early today.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":355.9,"start":354.39}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's almost always early.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":357.49,"start":355.9}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's the one who will have cleaned the break room by the time her coworkers arrive.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":362.51,"start":357.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"At UIC, your coworkers have your back.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":365.7,"start":362.51}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy could say this about all of the nurses on her crew.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":369.42,"start":365.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"One of those nurses is Clara Hochhauser.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":372.72,"start":369.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see her emerging from the locker room in gray scrubs and a scrub coat.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":376.62,"start":372.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Not everyone wears the scrub coat, but Clara does because it has better pockets and because it covers her tattoos.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":384,"start":376.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara has large, wise eyes, as if she sees more than other people.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":388.47,"start":384}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's a natural at nursing, but it wasn't obvious that it was where she would wind up.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":392.403,"start":388.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":393.32,"start":392.403}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I'm like a high school dropout.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":398.02,"start":396.096}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I really did not do well with school.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":400.33,"start":398.02}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And long story short, I just was like, never mind, I'll get my GED.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":404.65,"start":400.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I started working, and I worked in a coffee shop.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":407.88,"start":404.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"One day, Clara got a massage, and then she became a massage therapist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":412.06,"start":407.89}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And she found the clients she liked best were the pregnant clients, so then she decided to become a midwife.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":417.27,"start":412.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But after finishing her degree, she just wanted to start working.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":420.52,"start":417.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And as a nurse, she could do that sooner.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":423.33,"start":420.52}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She started as a mother-baby nurse and eventually switched to labor and delivery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":428.49,"start":423.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She never thought she would have her own kids.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":430.78,"start":428.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I definitely never planned on having children.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":433.57,"start":430.79}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I definitely always felt like, ooh, emotionally, a little dysfunctional family.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":440.29,"start":433.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Yeah, I identified purely as a lesbian.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":447.236,"start":440.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was not able to conceptualize what it meant to be bisexual.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":450.73,"start":447.236}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"That wasn't an option.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":451.96,"start":450.73}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It's either you were gay, you weren't gay, you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":454.14,"start":451.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":454.818,"start":454.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":455.61,"start":454.818}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And it just -- not that you can't have babies with women, but I just -- all the things, I just thought, no.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":461.95,"start":455.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"No, no, no.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":462.61,"start":461.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I love little babies, but I do not want to be a parent.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":465.237,"start":462.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And then Clara got divorced from her wife.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":467.57,"start":465.237}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She met a guy.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":468.74,"start":467.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"They got married.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":470.44,"start":468.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Suddenly, Clara understood she didn't have to be, as she puts it, a perfect, magical, special person to have children.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":477.7,"start":470.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She was 40.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":479.5,"start":477.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"With her husband, Clay, she did IVF, and soon she was pregnant with twins.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":484.33,"start":479.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was incredibly excited and could not believe that two embryos took when -- you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":492.67,"start":484.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It just all seemed surreal.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":494.26,"start":492.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I can't believe it worked, the very first transfer.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":497.48,"start":494.26}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But I, of course, was really nervous about the outcome because I see firsthand all the time the ways in which pregnancies can go sideways.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":506.93,"start":497.48}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And there are no guarantees that anybody goes home with a baby at the end.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":511.96,"start":506.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So it was just like another layer of worry.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":514.549,"start":511.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":515.71,"start":514.559}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":517.21,"start":515.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara would go home with her babies.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":519.64,"start":517.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That's not where this story is going.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":522.159,"start":519.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She would also be delivering at UIC herself.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":526.56,"start":522.159}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"On a medical drama, when the health care provider becomes the patient, it's a twist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":532.17,"start":526.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But this isn't a twist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":533.98,"start":532.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's our premise.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":535.89,"start":533.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We don't know how this matters yet, but it will.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":538.8,"start":535.89}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It matters that this patient is not a visitor, that she's not someone who leaves, but someone who stays.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":546.54,"start":538.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A twin pregnancy at age 40, there was definitely a chance that Clara would need a C-section, but she wanted to avoid it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":553.17,"start":546.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I wanted so badly to have a vaginal delivery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":558.1,"start":553.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I did not want to have surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":559.9,"start":558.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But because I was older, because I'm a bit fat --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":563.49,"start":559.9}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I just was like, oh, god.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":565.74,"start":563.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara also wanted to avoid delivering in the operating room.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":569.4,"start":565.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Typically, if you're having twins, you can labor in a labor room, but you have to deliver in the operating room, even if you're delivering vaginally.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":576.81,"start":569.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's a safety thing -- just be in the right room if something goes wrong.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":580.62,"start":576.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But Clara really did not want this.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":583.02,"start":580.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But the idea of having to deliver in the operating room was horrifying to me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":588.11,"start":583.03}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was just terrified of the OR, more or less.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":590.182,"start":588.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"How come?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":591.14,"start":590.182}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Delivering in the operating room always just seemed so awful to me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":597.57,"start":594.028}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I don't know.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":598.112,"start":597.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It's a really -- it's this really narrow metal table.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":602.49,"start":598.112}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Uh-huh.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":603.89,"start":602.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"You're flat on your back.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":606.5,"start":603.9}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"You're not restrained, but where are you going to go?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":609.36,"start":606.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"You've got an epidural.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":610.38,"start":609.36}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"You're going to be hooked up to more monitors.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":613.33,"start":610.38}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It just -- it takes away any of that just safety and autonomy and --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":621.784,"start":613.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":622.58,"start":621.784}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":624.62,"start":622.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"One of the things Clara did want was for Mindy, her coworker, to take pictures of the birth.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":630.02,"start":624.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY YouTube.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":652.49,"start":646.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And then one of my nursing friends was FIGUEROA","text":"She was like, I don't like to go to places.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":661.23,"start":658.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY oh.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":667.4,"start":666.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And then when she had her baby, she was like, can you take pictures of my baby?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":671.79,"start":667.41}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And she paid me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":672.692,"start":671.79}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I was like, you don't have to pay $200.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":677.79,"start":674.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I was like, [GASPS]:, that's a lot of PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":729.6,"start":726.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"On April 19, 2022, Clara arrived at the hospital for a scheduled induction, which is when you get drugs to start your labor.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":739.34,"start":730.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now, we flashback to see her on that day.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":741.96,"start":739.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She and her husband, Clay, are crossing the street from the staff garage.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":745.95,"start":741.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara's purposeful, leading the way.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":749.36,"start":745.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clay's just passed the bar, is going into criminal defense, did an internship advocating for victims of police brutality.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":757.22,"start":749.37}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It matters that you know something about Clay, so that he's a little more than just the cutout husband, more than just the husband watching the main event.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":765.53,"start":757.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"At the employee entrance, Clara badges in.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":768.8,"start":765.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was coming in for --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":770.72,"start":768.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was scheduled for an evening induction.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":773.57,"start":770.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So I thought, yeah, I like that.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":774.917,"start":773.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I like those evening inductions.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":776.25,"start":774.917}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So I'll come in at night after dinner, and I'll get the initial stuff and then go from there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":784.04,"start":776.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"On the fourth floor, Clara enters her labor room, room 5, the best one.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":789.63,"start":784.05}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That's where they try to put you if you're a staff member.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":792.59,"start":789.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Her co-workers have decorated it for her.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":795.74,"start":792.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She changes into a gown, climbs into bed.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":799.55,"start":795.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clay sets a Bluetooth speaker on the windowsill, opens his phone, starts the playlist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":805.37,"start":799.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"\"Push It\"-- it's on everyone's playlist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":807.78,"start":805.37}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The Beach Boys, \"Don't Worry, Baby.\"","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":811.49,"start":807.78}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And so far, Clara's not worried, even when she receives the drugs to start her labor.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":816.42,"start":811.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Everything feels surprisingly OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":819.22,"start":816.42}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"By around lunchtime the next day, she's in some pain from her contractions and is debating whether it's time to go for an epidural.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":826.54,"start":819.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I felt really --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":829.15,"start":826.55}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"really neurotic about it, like not wanting to get it too soon because I wanted to be able to stay upright and keep moving and --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":835.21,"start":829.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"but you don't want to wait too long because then you're dying, in pain.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":838.25,"start":835.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And one of my coworkers, a midwife, came in and talked with me and was just like, all right, Clara, it's fine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":846.53,"start":838.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Just get it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":847.19,"start":846.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"If you're ready, you can get it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":848.523,"start":847.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It's not -- it's nothing to get perfect here.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":851,"start":848.523}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Like, if you want it, and you know you want it, just do it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":854.09,"start":851}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So Heather did my epidural.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":857.62,"start":854.09}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather Nixon, the head of obstetric anesthesia at UIC.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":861.82,"start":857.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Charismatic, assertive.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":863.68,"start":861.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Boss lady, but not bossy.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":866.44,"start":863.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Let's actually meet Heather on the way into the room.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":869.11,"start":866.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Let's watch her leaving her office downstairs on the anesthesia floor.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":873.28,"start":869.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather's office -- mini fridge.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":875.45,"start":873.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"On top of it, a framed photo of four women dressed up for girls' night.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":879.11,"start":875.45}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A black leather couch with a hot pink pillow, where, lots of times, Heather spends the night.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":884.47,"start":879.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather is 51, with two daughters in college, but she's the one with the energy of a college kid, can sleep anywhere, pop up bright-eyed at weird hours.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":893.98,"start":884.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"My residents actually did a skit once with me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":897.1,"start":893.99}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"They do the end-of-the-year roast of the attendings.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":899.54,"start":897.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And it was a skit where it was like 3:00 in the morning, and they kept answering the phone.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":903.43,"start":899.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I was like, hey, it's Nixon from anesthesia!","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":905.66,"start":903.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And they're like, we have no idea how you're always awake.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":908.47,"start":905.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"You're always like, let's talk about stuff at 3:00 in the morning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":911.362,"start":908.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I'm like, I don't know.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":912.32,"start":911.362}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"So --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":913.9,"start":912.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather has lived in Chicago for 30 years, came to the city straight after finishing college.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":919.6,"start":913.91}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She knew she wanted to be a doctor, but she had to pay off student loans first.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":923.6,"start":919.6}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"So she worked as a shop girl in a bar off Rush Street, T-shirt tied up, abdomen showing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":929.8,"start":923.6}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Anesthesia itself came as a surprise to Heather.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":932.8,"start":929.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It wasn't a specialty she'd ever thought she'd want to do, but she had a mentor who made her fall in love with it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":938.77,"start":932.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This is the case for a lot of anesthesiologists.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":942.58,"start":938.77}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's a common misconception that this is the doctor who just puts you to sleep.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":947.11,"start":942.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But there's a lot more to it than that.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":949.66,"start":947.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The surgeon has their head down in the surgical field.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":953.32,"start":949.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The anesthesiologist is watching over all of you.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":957.88,"start":953.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"When Heather discovered the subspecialty of obstetric anesthesia, she had a feeling like, OB, this is my tribe, these are my people.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":966.17,"start":957.88}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I think you'll find two types of anesthesiologists.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":968.92,"start":966.17}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"You have the ones who are the introverts, who like to hide behind the drapes with the sleep patients.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":973.6,"start":968.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And then there's the type that really like to engage with their patients.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":977.21,"start":973.6}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And those are maybe the tribe of OB anesthesiologists, the ones who want to be there, talking to their patients.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":984.61,"start":977.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Many OB anesthesiologists proudly identify the same way.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":989.14,"start":984.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"They like awake patients, not sleeping patients.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":994.17,"start":989.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we catch back up to the action, and we see Heather enter Clara's room and begin arranging her equipment on a tray.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1001.55,"start":994.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara sits erect on the bed, waiting, bed pumped up high, her feet dangling.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1007.43,"start":1001.55}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She'd asked for Heather to do her epidural, like, hey, Nixon, are you going to be around?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1012.8,"start":1007.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather was happy to do it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1014.19,"start":1012.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She does this for all her providers, delivering if she can.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1016.98,"start":1014.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Not that a resident couldn't do it, but you want to take ownership if, God forbid, something goes wrong.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1024.05,"start":1016.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Close on Heather's gloved fingers touching Clara's spine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1028.25,"start":1024.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we're going to watch Heather actually do this procedure.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1030.92,"start":1028.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We're going to be talking a lot about procedures on this show, and viewers need to be grounded in them.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1035.94,"start":1030.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And does anyone really know what an epidural is, besides the thing you can get for pain when you're having a baby?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1043.099,"start":1035.94}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we see Clara take an anxious peek over her shoulder and Heather telling her, no, no, I'll talk you through it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1050,"start":1043.109}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"You'd think nurses and OBs, they'd be the most relaxed about the epidural, but they're just as nervous as anyone.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1057.35,"start":1050}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"From her tray, Heather picks up something that looks like a swizzle stick, like what you use to stir a cocktail.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1064.16,"start":1057.36}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This is actually a large, hollow needle.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1066.84,"start":1064.16}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And its placement in Clara's back just might cause someone to turn from the screen for just a second, so I'll tell you what Heather's doing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1073.44,"start":1066.84}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's inching that needle into Clara's back a little deeper, a little more, until the tip enters what's called the epidural space.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1081.62,"start":1073.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather finds that space by feel.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1084.29,"start":1081.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's a ligament she's looking for.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1086.55,"start":1084.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And not everyone's ligament feels the same.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1089.19,"start":1086.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Some of them feel really rubbery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1091.44,"start":1089.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Some of them feel kind of like crackly or poppily, popping.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1095.97,"start":1091.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Some of them feel really gentle.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1099.748,"start":1095.97}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Like, almost when you pass through, you're like, oh, something -- something's different, but I can't --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1104.04,"start":1099.748}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I'm just going to stop there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1105.92,"start":1104.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now, Heather threads a thin plastic tube, a catheter -- you know this word --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1110.59,"start":1105.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"through the large hollow needle, until the plastic tube is inside the epidural space as well.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1117.39,"start":1110.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We could go one level deeper with the science, explain that the epidural space is not really a space at all, just potential space, but I won't get into this, just nod to it so that doctors watching can be like, on this show, they know what they're talking about.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1132.03,"start":1117.39}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now, Heather slides the needle off the plastic tube, which stays in Clara's back.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1137.34,"start":1132.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Anesthetic drugs will be delivered through the tube, bathing the nerves near her spinal cord.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1143.49,"start":1137.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara is relieved when the procedure is over.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1147.03,"start":1143.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Even though it wasn't like a painful needle or something like that, it was such a strange, unnerving feeling, that pressure in your spine or whatever.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1157.68,"start":1147.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But I got it, and it was fine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1159.19,"start":1157.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But then around dinner time, I think, was the first time that things --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1162.63,"start":1159.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"that trouble started with my epidural, where I didn't really even understand what was happening because it was just in my vagina that I felt pain.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1171.84,"start":1162.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So I wasn't really --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1173.57,"start":1171.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I wasn't aware of contractions.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1176.33,"start":1173.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It was just all of a sudden, it felt like my vagina was just being shredded.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1182.72,"start":1176.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I don't know.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1183.32,"start":1182.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It literally felt like somebody had a steel toe boot and was just kicking around in there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1189.27,"start":1183.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Oh, jeez.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1191.18,"start":1189.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara's epidural is topped up with more drugs, and that does the trick.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1195.83,"start":1191.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's more comfortable right away.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1198.92,"start":1195.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A couple hours later, at 11 o'clock, Heather signs out to the anesthesiologist on the overnight shift and fills him in on Clara.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1207.68,"start":1198.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"When I was signing out, I was like, hey, this is the deal.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1210.96,"start":1207.69}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"It's working.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1211.71,"start":1210.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Blah, blah, blah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1212.9,"start":1211.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And so I didn't anticipate any problems when I left.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1217.083,"start":1212.9}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Otherwise, I would have probably stayed.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1218.75,"start":1217.083}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Like in hindsight now, I'm like -- one of the things I'm always like for my providers that I'm taking care of, I stay, just stay in the hospital because I just don't even want to --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1226.97,"start":1218.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I just want to be the one who's there, if anything happens.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1230.74,"start":1226.97}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see Heather get in her car, drive away from the hospital.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1234.76,"start":1230.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What happens after she leaves, that's coming up after the break.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1239.64,"start":1234.76}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara had been comfortable when Heather left, but several hours later, she's having the same pain again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1256.93,"start":1249.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And other things are going wrong, too.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1259.42,"start":1256.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Her labor is stalling.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1260.99,"start":1259.42}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Her blood sugar is climbing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1263.2,"start":1260.99}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"So were the baby's heart rates.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1266.32,"start":1263.2}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara knows she's headed for a C-section, but she requests one last half hour laboring on her hands and knees, just to see if that will help.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1274.66,"start":1266.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we see the room dark, except for the lights of the monitors, Clara on all fours in the hospital bed, close of her forearms.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1284.06,"start":1274.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We briefly glimpse the tattoos.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1286.07,"start":1284.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We remember for a moment that Clara has stripped a layer off for us.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1289.93,"start":1286.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's a lot of vulnerability in what she's allowing us to see.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1293.98,"start":1289.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The only other person in the room is Clay.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1296.39,"start":1293.99}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That was another thing Clara had requested -- just, please, everyone clear out, and give me one more try.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1303.1,"start":1296.39}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But the try doesn't work, and there's no more time to waste.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1306.82,"start":1303.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The nurses unplug Clara from her monitors and push her cumbersome bed down the hall to the OR.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1312.78,"start":1306.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But I was like, OK, it's going to be fine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1315.28,"start":1312.78}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It's going to be fine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1316.197,"start":1315.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"My baby is going to be born, so --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1318.732,"start":1316.197}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And yeah, she called me around 3:00 or 4:00 in the morning that they had decided to do a C-section.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1325.81,"start":1318.742}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Mindy was at home, asleep, but she got right out of bed and grabbed her camera bag.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1330.89,"start":1325.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see her, strap over her shoulder, hurrying down the bungalow's front steps and into her minivan.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1337.39,"start":1330.89}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I raced over there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1340.07,"start":1337.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And it was a little bit of an urgent case, meaning it's not what we call a crash, like where we literally just rip cords out of the wall and run.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1349.22,"start":1340.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"It was like, all right, we're doing this now.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1351.98,"start":1349.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Let's move.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1353.21,"start":1351.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So, I mean, I'm only 10 minutes away from the hospital when there's no traffic.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1357.2,"start":1353.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I raced over there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1358.57,"start":1357.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I parked in the street because I'm like, it's an urgent case.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1362.21,"start":1358.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I need to go because they might start before I get there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1364.79,"start":1362.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I even got a parking ticket that day because at night, you don't pay for the meters.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1369.35,"start":1364.79}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"But I was there so long that in the morning, they gave me a ticket.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1372.95,"start":1369.35}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"But anyways.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1373.94,"start":1372.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1376.75,"start":1373.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Up on the fourth floor, Mindy takes a plastic-wrapped surgical suit from a closet and pulls the cover-on over her clothes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1384.7,"start":1376.76}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Then she turns toward Clara's OR.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1387.28,"start":1384.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I walked in when she was on the operating room table.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1390.95,"start":1387.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I actually have a beautiful photo of her.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1394.33,"start":1390.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She has not seen these photos --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1396.59,"start":1394.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"or I gave them to her, but I don't think she's ever been able to look at them.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1400.64,"start":1396.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"But it's the door of the operating room halfway open, and she's laying there with her arms out.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1406.6,"start":1400.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And she's looking at me, smiling.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1408.61,"start":1406.6}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And -- yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1411.44,"start":1408.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So then, I mean, when I got there, and I took that picture, just her joy --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1416.47,"start":1411.45}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"and I almost sensed relief.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1419.09,"start":1416.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She knew I was there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1420.74,"start":1419.09}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And we are all either night-shift nurses or day-shift nurses.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1425.84,"start":1420.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And even though we're all one team, there's more of a friendship and bond.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1431.95,"start":1425.84}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Day-shift nurses, we all know how we work.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1434.14,"start":1431.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And night shift, we don't work with them, ever.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1436.94,"start":1434.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So we don't know how they roll, you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1439.24,"start":1436.94}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I think that smile was like, I'm having my babies.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1443.21,"start":1439.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"You made it to take my pictures.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1445.25,"start":1443.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"You're here.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1446.24,"start":1445.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"You're one of me, one of our team.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1448.61,"start":1446.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1449.27,"start":1448.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I, too, was like, yes, I'm here for you.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1452.18,"start":1449.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And, ugh, this is why this case is so hard because I feel like I failed her 100 percent.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1459.54,"start":1452.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"When Mindy arrives, Clara is still being prepped for surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1464.01,"start":1459.55}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's flat on her back in the OR, which is obviously not where she wanted to be.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1470.13,"start":1464.01}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The L&D operating rooms at UIC are relatively small, out of another era; mint green tiles on the walls, like you're stepping into the showers at a YWCA; harsh light.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1482.22,"start":1470.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But Clara is calm.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1484.92,"start":1482.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see her now through Mindy's viewfinder, her eyes closed, the expression on her face.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1490.72,"start":1484.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"My god, it's the embodiment of a word whose use is rarely earned --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1494.97,"start":1490.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"beatific.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1496.857,"start":1494.97}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I took pictures of everything.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1498.94,"start":1496.857}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I took pictures of Clay and her holding hands.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1502.48,"start":1498.94}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I took pictures of the teams waiting, two different teams for two different babies, pictures of anesthesia working.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1510.73,"start":1502.48}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Just, I like to take pictures of people there because we never get to do that because of privacy laws.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1516.34,"start":1510.73}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So for them to know that I'm on their team, it's almost like, here's a picture of you actually in a case.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1524.74,"start":1516.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Surgery is getting closer now.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1527.56,"start":1524.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There are poles on either side of Clara's bed.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1529.85,"start":1527.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And soon a giant piece of medical paper will be stretched between the poles, blocking Clara's view of her abdomen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1536.59,"start":1529.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This paper is called the drape, and it both protects the surgical field from contamination and protects the patient from the sight of her open body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1544.937,"start":1536.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1546.28,"start":1544.947}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The anesthesiologist has added more drugs to Clara's epidural, making it strong enough to get her through the surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1553.48,"start":1546.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now the doctors need to test to see if the anesthesia is working.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1557.53,"start":1553.48}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Tight on the skin test --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1559.16,"start":1557.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"it's so weirdly basic, the anesthesiologist poking Clara with a broken tongue depressor.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1565.18,"start":1559.16}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Another doctor does something more severe, clamping Clara's belly hard with a surgical instrument.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1571.33,"start":1565.18}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara feels none of it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1572.93,"start":1571.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And that means they're ready to go.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1574.55,"start":1572.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's a decision to make about the C-section, how much of this procedure to show.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1582.3,"start":1577.3}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Like Mindy said, how graphic are we doing?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1586.56,"start":1582.3}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We're not going for gore on this series, for showing open bodies for the kick of it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1591.42,"start":1586.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But we do want visceral, all the meanings of that word, viscera, literally -- that's what's inside a patient's abdomen --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1599.58,"start":1591.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"but also how that word is applied to art, art that's visceral.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1603.28,"start":1599.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's of the body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1604.36,"start":1603.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It attends to the body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1605.71,"start":1604.36}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Hopefully it makes you feel something in your body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1608.4,"start":1605.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A visceral aesthetic, muscular, close to the bone, raw but not sensational, not shying away.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1616.32,"start":1608.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"OK, enough self-regard, enough theory.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1619.05,"start":1616.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What does this mean in practice?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1620.403,"start":1619.05}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now the surgeon calls out \"incision\" and then cuts into Clara's abdomen, just above the pubic bone.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1630.06,"start":1623.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We're not seeing the scalpel in her flesh, OK, but just know that this kind of cut is called a bikini incision.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1635.7,"start":1630.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Bikini sounds tiny, but this cut is big.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1639.39,"start":1635.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Once Clara's abdomen is open, the surgeon needs to reach the uterus.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1644.1,"start":1639.39}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The uterus is behind a pair of muscles.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1647.19,"start":1644.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we see, actually see, the surgeon and the OB resident position themselves on either side of Clara and pull.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1654.69,"start":1647.2}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"These two women in scrubs pull so hard to separate this muscle that their bodies lean back, like in tug-of-war.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1662.13,"start":1654.69}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"This is a very physical surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1664.8,"start":1662.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"When Clara is a nurse in a C-section, she either covers her eyes or looks away for this part.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1671.31,"start":1664.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But of course, today Clara is the patient.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1674.58,"start":1671.31}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We go behind the drape now, tight on her face.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1677.61,"start":1674.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But something's different, radically different.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1680.79,"start":1677.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It was just moments ago that she was beatific, but now her mouth is tight.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1685.92,"start":1680.79}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I just remember all of a sudden just being like, oh my God, I don't feel good, you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1691.1,"start":1685.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1694.016,"start":1691.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1695.825,"start":1694.026}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I don't know
