--","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1696.45,"start":1695.825}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I assumed I was just panicking.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1698.85,"start":1696.45}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I assumed that I just needed to relax a little bit.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1703.97,"start":1698.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A few years earlier, Clara had had a panic attack during another surgery at UIC, an eye surgery, cataracts -- weird to have them at such a young age.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1713.21,"start":1703.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"In the surgery, a different kind of paper drape had been unfolded over Clara's whole body, like a death shroud, so that she was entirely covered in blue paper, except for a hole over one eye.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1725.21,"start":1713.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And then she'd heard the doctor say, you need to give her something else, she's hyperventilating.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1730.85,"start":1725.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"All through her pregnancy, she'd been worried that if she needed a C-section, she would have a panic attack again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1736.73,"start":1730.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And so I had spoken with Dr. Nixon about strategies for how to deal with that if I panic.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1745.19,"start":1736.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And we talked about the different medicines they can give and that sometimes, in that case, nitrous oxide is really nice, you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1752.34,"start":1745.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Just breathe the gas for a little bit because they don't last that long.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1755.34,"start":1752.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So maybe you can just breathe the gas for a minute or so, and it'll pass and then you'll be fine, you know?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1760.568,"start":1755.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1761.36,"start":1760.568}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"So I asked, can I just have some gas or something?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1766.14,"start":1761.37}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And they put the mask on, and it just was getting worse.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1769.8,"start":1766.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I remember feeling very nauseous and just saying that I wasn't OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1778.35,"start":1769.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And -- and then everything's really fuzzy and hazy.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1783.11,"start":1778.35}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I am not, I guess, thankfully, able to necessarily recall it in as much detail as I could at first.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1791.3,"start":1783.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But I -- it was an unfathomable amount of pain.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1799.28,"start":1791.3}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I remember begging them to stop.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1805.61,"start":1799.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And it wasn't until she just kept begging like, please, please, please.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1811.08,"start":1805.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And one of the attendings, she looked at me and told me to tell her that it was OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1818.4,"start":1811.08}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She told me to tell her partner, please tell him it's OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1822.12,"start":1818.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So at that moment, I was no longer a friend or an advocate.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1829.8,"start":1822.12}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I was more like a staff member being told by the doctor, like, it's fine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1834.21,"start":1829.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I remember telling Clay, like, Clay, this is normal.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1837.9,"start":1834.22}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"This sometimes happens.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1839.76,"start":1837.9}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And Clay, I remember his body language was very like, yeah, OK, I hear you, but don't talk to me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1846.69,"start":1839.76}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I remember being like, oh my gosh, because he was so stressed out.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1853.88,"start":1846.69}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"That's one thing I regret the most, that that provider looked at me and said, tell them it's OK, and that I did what she told me to, knowing that it wasn't OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1864.09,"start":1853.88}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"I think that's one of my biggest things that I replay over and over again, that I didn't say, it's not OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1871.05,"start":1864.09}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Can we stop?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1872.13,"start":1871.05}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1875.058,"start":1872.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara's anesthesia is not working.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1882.95,"start":1879.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She is now in the middle of major abdominal surgery, and she can feel that surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1890.96,"start":1882.95}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara knew this could happen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1892.86,"start":1890.96}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She had seen this happen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1895.07,"start":1892.86}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Intraoperative pain during cesarean.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1898.04,"start":1895.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Health care providers know about it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1900.92,"start":1898.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Patients don't.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1903.65,"start":1900.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"When Clara herself first started working on L&D, and patients in labor would tell her, from my last baby, I had a C-section, and I felt everything, Clara would think to herself, that can't be true.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1915.355,"start":1903.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's no way.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1915.98,"start":1915.355}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Who would do that?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1918.08,"start":1915.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And then she saw it happen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1920.24,"start":1918.08}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And now it is happening to her.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1921.91,"start":1920.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Visceral, that key word.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1928.07,"start":1925.64}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What Clara is feeling is visceral pain, meaning pain that originates inside her abdomen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1934.06,"start":1928.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"When the doctors did the skin test, Clara didn't feel it, right?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1937.13,"start":1934.06}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She was numb.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1938.44,"start":1937.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But sometimes a cesarean patient is numb when you test her skin.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1942.02,"start":1938.44}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And when you open her up, you find she's not.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1945.1,"start":1942.02}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There are a lot of reasons for this, but in the moment, the reason for the pain doesn't totally matter.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1950.35,"start":1945.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What matters is that you treat it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1952.125,"start":1950.35}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The babies -- we missed the delivery, but we see them now, at the edge of the room, in newborn warmers.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1960.53,"start":1954.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And we understand they are healthy, that they are OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1964.1,"start":1960.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But Clara is not.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1966.43,"start":1964.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see Clara punching the drape as if trying to hit the OBs.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1971.59,"start":1966.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What are the OBs doing on the other side of the drape?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1974.12,"start":1971.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What are they understanding?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1975.363,"start":1974.12}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What are they feeling?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1976.28,"start":1975.363}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Why are they ordering Mindy to tell Clara's husband everything is all right?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1980.86,"start":1976.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We don't know the answers to these questions yet.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1983,"start":1980.87}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We're on the side of the drape with Clara and the anesthesiologist, who's giving her supplemental drugs --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1988.4,"start":1983}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"fentanyl, ketamine.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1990.43,"start":1988.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Is he doing the right thing, giving her those drugs?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1993.17,"start":1990.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We don't know this yet either, but the feeling we convey now is that something is wrong, very wrong.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":1999.64,"start":1993.17}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What's going on inside for Clara is that all these drugs have her hallucinating.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2004.59,"start":1999.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Is this the kind of show where we do a magical realism thing of inhabiting her consciousness?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2009.07,"start":2004.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I mean, it could be, yes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2010.32,"start":2009.07}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Why not use it this way?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2011.89,"start":2010.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Why not use it to show what Clara is seeing?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2015.33,"start":2011.89}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"A story I heard --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2016.33,"start":2015.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I'll say this fast --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2017.65,"start":2016.33}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"a mother is given ketamine during her C-section.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2020.83,"start":2017.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Her baby is born, and the nurse brings her the baby.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2024.01,"start":2020.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And the patient says, this is a lovely baby, but this is not my baby.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2028.39,"start":2024.01}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"My baby does not have two heads.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2031.77,"start":2028.39}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I heard this story from a doctor.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2033.318,"start":2031.77}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It happened while she was still a resident.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2035.11,"start":2033.318}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And she told me that after that woman, she never used ketamine for a cesarean patient again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2039.73,"start":2035.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2041.88,"start":2039.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What Clara is seeing, we see now --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2044.16,"start":2041.89}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"colors and shapes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2046.29,"start":2044.16}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"If you're a certain kind of person, you might be fine looking at an open abdomen, but freaked out looking at hallucinations.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2052.409,"start":2046.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara feels unable to communicate.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2055.44,"start":2052.409}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She was just so slurry.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2057.25,"start":2055.45}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Like, please, please.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2060.27,"start":2057.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Like, stop.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2061.92,"start":2060.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"No, no, no.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2065.29,"start":2061.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She sounded like she was out of her body at that point.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2068.71,"start":2065.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I almost started thinking, I know she's had issues with post-traumatic stress-type issues.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2079.15,"start":2068.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"So I'm like, maybe this is not pain thing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2083.29,"start":2079.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"Maybe it's a psychological thing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2085.719,"start":2083.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"And I mean, this happens a lot where patients complain of pain, and we brush it off as she's anxious.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2093.81,"start":2085.729}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"It's just pressure.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2095.409,"start":2093.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"But it wasn't because she would feel anytime they touched or did the cautery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2103.68,"start":2095.409}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She would say, the burning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2105.21,"start":2103.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"MINDY FIGUEROA","text":"She could feel the burning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2107.155,"start":2105.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The cautery instrument is called the Bovie.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2109.53,"start":2107.155}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It stanches bleeding.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2111.15,"start":2109.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And the red-hot pain of it is something Clara remembers precisely, something that, years later, would wake her up in the middle of the night, the sear of that instrument, Clara exclaiming, ow, and a doctor saying, we'll move to the other side.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2125.36,"start":2111.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2127.82,"start":2125.36}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's still a lot of surgery left after the delivery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2131.24,"start":2127.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And now we're going to see a part I know some people might not want to see.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2134.52,"start":2131.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Brace for it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2135.21,"start":2134.52}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I'm giving you the warning.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2136.59,"start":2135.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The doctor is lifting Clara's uterus out of her body and resting it on her abdomen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2142.31,"start":2136.59}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's like a giant, shiny Easter egg.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2145.13,"start":2142.31}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The uterus has been exteriorized.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2147.54,"start":2145.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That's what this is called.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2148.83,"start":2147.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And the reason we're seeing this is, please remember that Clara can feel this, can feel her organ being lifted out of her body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2156.86,"start":2148.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Oh, and at some point during all of this, Clara starts throwing up.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2162.26,"start":2156.86}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now the surgeon sticks a good portion of her forearm into Clara's body.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2166.58,"start":2162.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What we see in the shot is just the arm disappearing into the abdomen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2170.66,"start":2166.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She's using a pad of gauze to check for internal bleeding.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2174.74,"start":2170.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Again, the point is, Clara is feeling this.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2178.49,"start":2174.74}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Now we hear her scream, why are you doing this?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2182.1,"start":2178.49}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Make it stop.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2183.13,"start":2182.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And now we do.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2187.26,"start":2186.17}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"As if on her command, we leave the surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2189.24,"start":2187.26}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We need to get out of this OR, where bad things are happening, and we don't understand why.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2193.345,"start":2189.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Outside of the operating room, an obstetric anesthesiologist named Corey is arriving for his 7:00 AM shift.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2202.88,"start":2196.02}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey, we're not going to meet Corey as a main character.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2206.13,"start":2202.88}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Maybe he's someone who will be developed later in another episode.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2209.1,"start":2206.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"He's trim and boyishly handsome.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2211.23,"start":2209.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We watch as several nurses urge him toward the OR.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2214.08,"start":2211.23}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey, you need to get in there now.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2216.98,"start":2214.08}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey pushes open the door and enters the room, just as the surgeons are putting the final stitches in Clara's skin.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2223.7,"start":2216.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And then, all of a sudden, at some point, it was over.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2227.66,"start":2223.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I just --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2229.58,"start":2227.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"the first thing I remember is just looking around, and then Corey was there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2236.13,"start":2229.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"He's one of the --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2237.41,"start":2236.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"he's one of the anesthesiologists.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2239.58,"start":2237.41}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I remember seeing Corey.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2241.618,"start":2239.58}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"He came right by -- down my face, because I was still on the table.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2244.41,"start":2241.618}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"But all the drapes were -- everything was gone and done.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2246.15,"start":2244.41}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And Corey was right there.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2247.5,"start":2246.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"And I remember I was just like, oh, Corey, you'll help me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2251.08,"start":2247.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"I was just like, oh, you'll help me.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2254.66,"start":2251.08}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2255.68,"start":2254.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Clara knows him, trusts him, unlike the other anesthesiologist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2260.43,"start":2255.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She had no idea who that guy was.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2262.97,"start":2260.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"We see some relief in Clara's face, and we see Corey holding back tears.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2267.36,"start":2262.97}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And even though there's no resolution or total explanation, at least we know that Clara is being cared for.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2274.4,"start":2267.36}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey wheels Clara to the recovery room, the PACU.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2278.04,"start":2274.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And as soon as she's settled, Corey goes down the hall and calls his boss, Heather.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2282.883,"start":2278.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"He calls me and he's like, Heather, something happened.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2285.8,"start":2282.883}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I was like, OK, what's going on?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2290.063,"start":2285.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather was at home.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2291.48,"start":2290.063}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"She'd been at the hospital so long the night before that she'd got the day off.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2295.52,"start":2291.48}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Corey told her about Clara.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2297.367,"start":2295.52}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"Oh, my god.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2298.45,"start":2297.367}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"No, no, no, no, no, no.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2299.85,"start":2298.45}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"That can't -- that just can't be.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2301.25,"start":2299.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I was like, Corey, what happened?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2303.47,"start":2301.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"He's like, I don't even know.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2305.72,"start":2303.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I just felt --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2309.503,"start":2305.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"[SIGHS]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2310.922,"start":2309.503}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I felt horrible.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2316.46,"start":2314.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I felt like I shouldn't have left the hospital, that I should have just stayed until she was safely taken care of, that she had delivered, that I had let her down in that.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2331.822,"start":2316.46}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And then I got mad.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2334.57,"start":2331.822}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And then I got really mad.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2337.12,"start":2334.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Heather is mad because she's in charge here, and she's an anesthesiologist.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2342.34,"start":2337.13}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The thing an anesthesiologist is in the room to do is manage pain.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2347.83,"start":2342.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Cutting someone's body open and then operating when they can feel it, that is not supposed to happen.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2355.51,"start":2347.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That's something from history or from war.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2358.9,"start":2355.51}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But in the United States, it happens 100,000 times a year.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2363.04,"start":2358.91}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That's the best estimate of how many patients have significant pain during cesarean.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2368.92,"start":2363.04}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Not all of these patients feel the exact same intensity of pain, or at the same parts of the surgery, or for the same length of time.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2377.56,"start":2368.92}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But the pain they feel is significant.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2381.79,"start":2377.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Most people don't know about this.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2384.37,"start":2381.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Until recently, I didn't.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2386.24,"start":2384.37}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I learned of it from listeners to season one of this podcast.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2390.4,"start":2386.24}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It doesn't matter if you haven't heard season one.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2393.28,"start":2390.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"The details are less important than the common experience it described, pain a doctor didn't listen to, pain a doctor didn't adequately treat.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2402.85,"start":2393.28}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"That experience resonated with many listeners.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2405.68,"start":2402.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And hundreds of them, mostly women, began writing to me with their own stories.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2411.7,"start":2405.68}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"One afternoon, I opened a note that was unlike any I'd received so far.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2416.83,"start":2411.71}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"\"I had a C-section,\" the email began, \"where anesthesia was not properly administered.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2423.1,"start":2416.83}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I remember telling them I could feel the cutting, the moving of my organs, the burning, shocking, brutal pain, and being told that wasn't possible and that I would just have to tough it out.\"","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2434.34,"start":2423.1}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"To me, this listener's experience seemed so out of range that it might be singular.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2439.54,"start":2434.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Then I opened two more of these notes.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2442.27,"start":2439.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Soon I understood this was a subject that would come up again and again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2447.76,"start":2442.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"C-sections are the most frequently performed surgery in the world.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2451.99,"start":2447.77}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"In the US, there are 1.2 million of them a year.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2456.19,"start":2451.99}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"So 100,000 patients a year feeling pain during cesarean, that's 8 percent.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2462.38,"start":2456.19}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Some people say the rate is even higher.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2465.34,"start":2462.38}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"There's no other surgery where this happens, no other major surgery where it would be acceptable for 8 percent of patients to feel that surgery.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2476.8,"start":2465.34}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"8 percent is a brand new number from a recently completed study.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2481.25,"start":2476.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It didn't replace an old number.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2483.32,"start":2481.25}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It's the first number of its kind.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2486.31,"start":2483.32}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Until now, nobody had ever done a study like this, asking thousands of patients in the US and Canada whether they felt pain during their C-sections.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2497.14,"start":2486.31}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But now the study has been done by doctors who recognize that this is a problem, and that putting a number to it is a step toward solving it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2506.53,"start":2497.15}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And this is what the story is about.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2509.35,"start":2506.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Not just that there's a problem with severe pain, but that people are trying to solve it.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2514.59,"start":2509.35}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"As soon as I finished season one of \"The Retrievals,\" people began asking me, what are the solutions to fixing this problem in medicine of dismissing women's pain?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2528.7,"start":2518.99}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I was surprised the first time I got this question about solutions.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2532.4,"start":2528.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Obviously, I should not have been surprised.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2534.91,"start":2532.4}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But I didn't have a bullet point list.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2537.29,"start":2534.91}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"How to shift an entire culture, how to listen to women patients --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2541.54,"start":2537.29}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"these are really complicated issues.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2544.27,"start":2541.54}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And solutions had not been the focus of my reporting.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2547.42,"start":2544.27}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"I looked at what went wrong.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2549.55,"start":2547.43}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Exploring what went wrong doesn't automatically translate to solutions on how to make it right.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2555.67,"start":2549.55}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"But this question made me curious.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2557.66,"start":2555.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Well, what are the solutions?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2560.65,"start":2557.66}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It turned out that a bunch of people interested in pain during cesarean were thinking about the same thing.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2567.52,"start":2560.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"So here we go, a case study in solving one of medicine's most persistent problems --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2573.67,"start":2567.53}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"listening to women patients and adequately treating their pain --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2578.56,"start":2573.67}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"told through the experiences of four women, Clara, Heather, Mindy, and Suzanna, who run up against this problem and take it on with efforts that touch both individual patients and entire countries.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2593.5,"start":2578.56}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"How do they do this?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2594.98,"start":2593.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"What can they change?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2596.65,"start":2594.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And what does it cost them?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2599.089,"start":2596.65}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2601.963,"start":2599.099}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Back at the hospital, Clara has been moved from the PACU to a bed.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2611.8,"start":2606.77}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"It isn't long before she hears from Heather.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2614.083,"start":2611.8}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"It was that day.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2615.5,"start":2614.083}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"She was really upset, too.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2617.01,"start":2615.5}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"[CRYING]","text":"She was really sorry that it happened.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2620.74,"start":2617.01}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Yeah.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2621.768,"start":2620.75}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Because Corey, obviously -- yeah, Corey told her.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2624.56,"start":2621.768}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"Anyway -- and she was really sorry.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2632.62,"start":2627.81}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"The first time I saw her, she looked at me, and she goes, Heather, what the fuck?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2638.82,"start":2632.63}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"What the fuck, Heather?","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2641.52,"start":2638.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I just went, (WHISPERING) I am so sorry.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2644.85,"start":2641.52}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And she was really --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2647.82,"start":2644.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"it was hard.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2648.61,"start":2647.82}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"She was really, really raw.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2649.93,"start":2648.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"She was not OK.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2651.84,"start":2649.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I said to her --","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2652.86,"start":2651.85}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I said, listen, when you're ready, I'd love to just get some information from you.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2659.47,"start":2652.86}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I said, because I'm going to take this beyond where we are right now.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2662.98,"start":2659.47}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"I said, I'm going to make sure that, institutionally, this doesn't happen again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2666.61,"start":2662.98}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"HEATHER NIXON","text":"And I'm going to make sure that people hear about this and that this can be used for good.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2670.513,"start":2666.61}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"She wasn't going to let it go, and she was going to take action.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2673.93,"start":2670.513}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"She was going to do something to prevent this from happening again.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2678.915,"start":2673.93}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"CLARA HOCHHAUSER","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2682.31,"start":2678.925}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And now we see Clara in her bed, and we follow her gaze, out of the window, out of the hospital, down to the street, where we pause for a second over Mindy's minivan, an orange parking ticket on the windshield.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2699.48,"start":2685.72}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And then we continue across the city, arcing back over the same elevated tracks and wide highways we traversed earlier, only now it's dusk instead of dawn.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2709.14,"start":2699.48}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And when we get to the lake, we turn around so that we can see the sunset over those magnificent buildings, their windows fiery with the day's last light.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2717.7,"start":2709.14}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"And we hold that shot as the music swells and the credits roll.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2721.31,"start":2717.7}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"From Serial Productions and \"The New York Times,\" I'm Susan Burton, and this is \"The Retrieval,\" Season 2, \"The C-sections.\"","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2736.876,"start":2728.62}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Next up, Heather.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2750.584,"start":2747.21}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"[MUSIC PLAYING]","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2754.56,"start":2750.594}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"\"The Retrievals\" is written and reported by me, Susan Burton and produced by me, Julie Snyder, and Ben Phelan.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2762.03,"start":2754.57}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Julie edited the series.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2764.11,"start":2762.03}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Ben did research and fact-checking.","timecode":{"__typename":"AudioTimecode","end":2766.59,"start":2764.11}},{"__typename":"AudioTranscriptFragment","speaker":"SUSAN BURTON","text":"Be sure to sign up for our newsletter, where each week, we'll share more reporting from the show, listener stories, and reading
